title: devboard
description: Devboard is a project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and CSS, leveraging MUI for UI components and React Query for efficient data fetching. It serves as a development playground and template, exploring best practices and common patterns within a modern React ecosystem, focusing on topics like component structure, data management, and UI design.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that implements a modern and responsive voting application. This repository houses the code for the application, focusing on providing a user-friendly interface and robust backend logic for managing and participating in various voting scenarios. It aims to be a flexible and extensible platform for conducting polls and making collective decisions.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt. This repository provides a simple and intuitive interface for logging sleep patterns and calculating the accumulated deficit, promoting better sleep habits and awareness. The project showcases practical application of TypeScript and modern web development practices.

title: resume
description: This repository houses the source code for my resume, crafted using TeX for precise formatting and converted to HTML for easy online viewing. It serves as a project showcasing my skills in document preparation and web presentation, focusing on creating a polished and accessible professional profile.

This project, built using TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, explores a specific project topic. It leverages TypeScript for robust typing and modern JavaScript for dynamic functionality, styled with CSS and structured with HTML to create a functional and engaging user experience within the defined project scope.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern dashboard application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository serves as a practical example and starting point for building data-rich web interfaces, exploring topics related to front-end development best practices, UI design, and component architecture within the Next.js ecosystem.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project utilizing TypeScript and JavaScript to [insert primary purpose of the project here, e.g., "build a modern task management application", "develop a new API for data processing", "create a reusable UI component library"]. This repository encompasses the core codebase and related resources for this project, focusing on [mention specific area of focus, e.g., "improving user experience", "optimizing performance", "enhancing security"].

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface, built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, for visualizing and interacting with data from a Robofleet robotics system. This project focuses on developing a user-friendly dashboard to monitor robot status, sensor data, and other relevant information, enabling efficient fleet management and data analysis.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-Event-Calendar is a project built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to create a visually appealing and interactive event calendar. This repository provides a foundation for dynamically displaying and managing events within a web application, offering features such as date navigation, event listing, and customizable styling.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase to provide a comprehensive solution for tracking Internet of Things (IoT) assets. This repository demonstrates best practices for modern web development, incorporating serverless architecture with Supabase for data storage and authentication, and utilizing Tailwind CSS for a responsive and visually appealing user interface.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project leveraging the Gemini API with a modern tech stack built with TypeScript, Vite.js, Express.js, CSS, HTML, and JavaScript. This repository showcases a practical implementation exploring the capabilities of the Gemini API within a structured and well-organized project, offering a valuable resource for developers interested in AI integration and modern web development practices.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project showcasing interactive map visualizations built using HTML for the front-end and Python for data processing or backend functionalities (if applicable). This repository demonstrates techniques for displaying geographical data and insights, falling under the general topic of project-based learning and showcasing mapping skills.

title: jovian
description: The `jovian` repository is a Python-based CRUD application built with Flask and PostgreSQL, demonstrating a practical project for managing data. Leveraging HTML, CSS, and shell scripting for front-end presentation and server-side deployment respectively, it provides a foundational example of a full-stack web application suitable for learning and experimentation with Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, and web development principles.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains personal finance projects. It explores various financial concepts through practical coding exercises and data analysis, covering topics such as budgeting, investment tracking, and financial modeling.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, it provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and explore ROS log data for debugging and performance analysis. This project focuses on improving the ROS development workflow through enhanced log visualization.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project leveraging TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript to create a dynamic and interactive idea board application. This repository aims to provide a platform for brainstorming, organizing thoughts, and collaborating on project ideas in a visually appealing and user-friendly manner.

title: atg-world
description: atg-world is a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This repository houses the codebase for [briefly describe the project's purpose, e.g., a personal portfolio website, a data visualization tool, etc.] and explores [mention key project topics, e.g., responsive design, interactive elements, backend integration]. It serves as a demonstration of [mention specific skills or focus, e.g., modern web development practices, data analysis techniques, full-stack application development].

title: fruit-seller
description: fruit-seller is a full-stack e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and JavaScript. It utilizes React Query for efficient data fetching and MUI for a modern UI, providing a type-safe and scalable foundation for selling fruits online. This repository serves as a practical example of modern web development techniques and best practices.
